summary: REQ-1 and REQ-3 appear to be addressed (backend caller-profile query no longer enforces authorization; Profile page now renders an explicit error state with retry). REQ-1’s upgrade/no-data-loss acceptance criterion is not evidenced in the diff. REQ-2’s required non-admin visibility + banned-user-null behavior cannot be confirmed because the getUserProfile implementation is truncated.

missing_requirements.requirement: Existing users created before this fix can still load their profiles after upgrade (no data loss).
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows getCallerUserProfile now returns userProfiles.get(caller), and adds a no-op migration module, but provides no evidence of stable storage/migration logic ensuring pre-existing userProfiles data persists across upgrade.

missing_requirements.requirement: Fix backend profile visibility so getUserProfile(<someOtherUserPrincipal>) as a normal authenticated user returns that user's profile (or null if it does not exist) without trapping Unauthorized, and returns null for banned users.
missing_requirements.reason: backend/main.mo is truncated right after a comment about allowing viewing non-banned profiles; the actual getUserProfile function body/authorization logic and banned handling are not visible in the provided diff summary, so implementation cannot be verified.

hallucinated_features.description: Added/changed extensive 'premium glassmorphism' UI/theme updates (global styles, Tailwind tokens, animated rings, premium shadows, layout changes) beyond the requested profile-load failure handling.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest only asks to improve error handling on the Profile page and make backend profile calls non-trapping; it does not request a broad UI redesign/theme overhaul.

hallucinated_features.description: Introduced new global startup flow/error classification and dedicated startup screen/error boundary components.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by any requirement; REQ-3 is limited to Profile page profile-fetch error handling with retry.

hallucinated_features.description: Added/expanded reusable page state component system (loading/error/empty/skeleton) across the app.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-3 only requires Profile page not to appear stuck and to show an error with retry; a generalized state framework is not requested.
Not requested; while the non-goal mentions no WebSocket-based refresh for profiles, implementing polling for messages is still an unrequested feature in this change set.
